prompt: <description>Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] The 2D sketch will be constructed on a plane defined by this coordinate system. For this sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and draw the following lines: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0485, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.0485, 0.0], End Point [0.0485, 0.0485] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.0485, 0.0485], End Point [0.0, 0.0485] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0485], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This closure of line\\_1 and line\\_4 forms the final loop on this face. Now, it's time to scale the 2D sketch. Apply a scaling factor of 0.0485. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using Euler angles and translation vector provided by the given coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.75 * sketch\\_scale: 0.0485 The resulting shape will be a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, having the following dimensions: * Length: 0.0485 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0485 With this, part 1 is complete. Proceed to create subsequent parts as needed, following the same pattern and using the given JSON information. Remember, each part's instructions should begin by stating the shape being constructed and follow the detailed step-by-step instructions for building that part, including clear headings, section breaks, and concise language.</description>
